segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in it, but she’s not even reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so oblivious to everything around her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s missing the whole thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like a little acrobat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m amazed he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting so patiently, her hand outstretched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this anymore—someone needs to step in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But at the same time, it’s kind of fascinating to see how this plays out.
segments.speaker: PAR
